snippet.textDisplay: What did y'all think of the battle system? I like the inclusion of Double and Triple Acts. Giving the actions proper animations adds a whole dimension of polish that I feel was missing from the original.
snippet.textOriginal: What did y'all think of the battle system? I like the inclusion of Double and Triple Acts. Giving the actions proper animations adds a whole dimension of polish that I feel was missing from the original.

snippet.textDisplay: I dont like undertale at all, but the music was always great!
snippet.textOriginal: I dont like undertale at all, but the music was always great!

snippet.textDisplay: @Louis Claudel I wish more people like you were in any kind of fandoms. Bless your soul.
snippet.textOriginal: @Louis Claudel I wish more people like you were in any kind of fandoms. Bless your soul.

snippet.textDisplay:
@DScribbleF aaah yes i see. I totally understand. As you can see from my avatar i'm an "undertale-fag", lol.... Even tho i never really liked the community of the game. As you said, lots of cringy weird kids doing weird stuff. And yeah, overall the fanbase is pretty atrocious. This is one of the reason why i personnaly don't identify myself as "part" of that fanbase, even tho I adore the game. 


I can understand your feelings, when people overhype something it always become annoying after a certain time. 
But the most important thing in the end is the "game". Not the fans, not the community, just the "game" itself. Which is still one hell of an experience !


And as you said, you seem to feel like the game and the musics are great (and they really are haha), but what stops you is the opinion you have from it because of the community.... So if i can "reassure" you in any way (not sure this is the correct word for that lol), i'll just say that, don't worry, the game is not what the fans make it look like. It's  hard to articulate, but what  i simply mean, is that, if you ever feel like playing it one day, you'll be happy to notice that it doesn't affiliate with all the cringy weird stuff you saw from the fans, it's just..... a very good game. And that's it x) cringy fan or not. hope one day, you can give it shot and appreciate its worth for what it is o/ peace
snippet.textOriginal:
@DScribbleF aaah yes i see. I totally understand. As you can see from my avatar i'm an "undertale-fag", lol.... Even tho i never really liked the community of the game. As you said, lots of cringy weird kids doing weird stuff. And yeah, overall the fanbase is pretty atrocious. This is one of the reason why i personnaly don't identify myself as "part" of that fanbase, even tho I adore the game. 


I can understand your feelings, when people overhype something it always become annoying after a certain time. 
But the most important thing in the end is the "game". Not the fans, not the community, just the "game" itself. Which is still one hell of an experience !


And as you said, you seem to feel like the game and the musics are great (and they really are haha), but what stops you is the opinion you have from it because of the community.... So if i can "reassure" you in any way (not sure this is the correct word for that lol), i'll just say that, don't worry, the game is not what the fans make it look like. It's  hard to articulate, but what  i simply mean, is that, if you ever feel like playing it one day, you'll be happy to notice that it doesn't affiliate with all the cringy weird stuff you saw from the fans, it's just..... a very good game. And that's it x) cringy fan or not. hope one day, you can give it shot and appreciate its worth for what it is o/ peace

snippet.textDisplay: @Louis Claudel I'm not the original commenter, but for me personally, the absolute tyranny of the fandom back when the game was most popular and the horror stories I heard of how they treated people was enough to turn me away from the game completely. It's a shame, the game looks really good, and the music is great, but I have negative desire to play it.
snippet.textOriginal: @Louis Claudel I'm not the original commenter, but for me personally, the absolute tyranny of the fandom back when the game was most popular and the horror stories I heard of how they treated people was enough to turn me away from the game completely. It's a shame, the game looks really good, and the music is great, but I have negative desire to play it.

snippet.textDisplay: If you're not stuck at work, you can play the start of what seems to be the sequel to Undertale, for free. As a big fan of Undertale, this is exciting! Toby Fox dropped the link in the description. As with Undertale, I do not recommend reading anything on it until you play it yourself. This track instantly reminds me of something Yoko Shimomura would compose (I especially get Radiant Historia vibes).
snippet.textOriginal: If you're not stuck at work, you can play the start of what seems to be the sequel to Undertale, for free. As a big fan of Undertale, this is exciting! Toby Fox dropped the link in the description. As with Undertale, I do not recommend reading anything on it until you play it yourself. This track instantly reminds me of something Yoko Shimomura would compose (I especially get Radiant Historia vibes).

snippet.textDisplay: @Luci So +1 for the Shimomura vibe. Been listening to KH and FFXV a lot lately. This fits in sweetly
snippet.textOriginal: @Luci So +1 for the Shimomura vibe. Been listening to KH and FFXV a lot lately. This fits in sweetly

snippet.textDisplay: I had the exact same thought! It definitely felt like a Yoko Shimomura piece! Like a combo of a map/world bgm from Kingdom Hearts and Legend of Mana for me!
snippet.textOriginal: I had the exact same thought! It definitely felt like a Yoko Shimomura piece! Like a combo of a map/world bgm from Kingdom Hearts and Legend of Mana for me!
